dialogue.String: Hm...The Zurk's inner demons tell him he's going the rightaru way...1�
I'm not so sure. We're deep-weep into 8����, you know.1�
Zurko, look out!Something-womething's there!1�
Aaah!What sort of baneful-waneful netherworld spawn is that!?1�
Oh no, it's coming-woming this way...1�
Maniacal maesters...What the...?1�
Zurko...I'm begging-wegging you...get out of here...1�
You slimy sea bastard!1�
Urrrg...1�
Zurko, promise-womise me one thing.1�
Concentrate!Must...liberataru Mikolulu...from the clutches...of evil!1�
Promise me...you won't blame-wame yourself...please?1�
Stop!Don't make me do this!Stoooooop!1�
It's not...your faultaru...1�
Noooooooooooo!1�
<Ka-chink>You may use the 3����  [no more/one/two] [/ more time/ more times].1�
What sort of half-brained demon did you let possess-wess you!?1�
This place is full of dangers and horrors too terrible-werrible of which to speak! Retreataru before there's less of you left than the glove you just picked up!1�
Urk...So, you've witnessed it...the pathos of a traitor who dared violataru the most sacred of familial writs.1�
Yes...The Zurk's committed unspeakable-weakable crimes for which he must forever atone.1�
He cannot even find solace in a scapegoat or straw man, for the totality of blame falls solely upon him. If only this rune were not cursed so!1�
...departaru at once, while you still have your life!�
Long time no see,  .To be honest, I thought I'd be reunited with Sverdhried before you were etched with 3����. <Smirk>1�
Don't take it the wrong way. I was just pulling your leg for old time's sake.1�
By the by, you've heard of the legendary swordswoman Marjami, right? Or did you succumb to one too many tarichuk poisonings?1�
Do you know Marjami?Yeah, she's much better than you.No, that poison's pretty strong.1�
Ohhh, I see you can give as well as take.Well, let's do some reminiscing while we wait for your sword to gain power.1�
Well, at least they didn't kill your sense of humor. Allow me to refresh your memory.1�
It all happened generations before even my grandfather of many greats came into being.1�
A few letters reveal themselves against the corn silk background of your 3���� after dipping it in the river.1�
You have obtained new information regarding your 3����.1�
You have obtained new information regarding your 3����.1�

Thanks for coming all this way.I'd love to offer you some hospitality, but we'd need to get this frontier station completed first!Could you lend us a hand by signing up for a coalition assignment?1�
Thanks so much for delivering this 3����! I can't wait to see how this station looks once it's built.If you want, you can go pick up your reward from the manager who gave you this assignment.1�
We're glad you tried your best, but destroyed 5���� are useless to us.Sorry, but can you pick up another one from the manager in charge?1�
Welcome to the frontier!This station has already been built, but you can always help construct some bivouacs or keep them supplied.1�
Frontier stations are self-sufficient, but the bivouacs are sadly not. We'd be extremely appreciative if you could undertake some assignments to make sure they stay in operation.1�
Thank you for helping us out.Here's the 3����. All we ask is that you take it to the manager in charge of this assignment.1�
Well, here's another 3����, but please be careful not to break this one.1�
Hello, there! We have some materials we'd like delivered to town, but we have to go through the right channels.Would you mind undertaking a coalition assignment to transport them back?1�
Thank you for helping us out. All we ask is that you deliver your cargo safely to the manager in charge of this assignment.1�
Good day to you. This is  �[the future site of /]frontier bivouac  [#1/#2/#3/#4/#5].1�

Thank you for the 3����. We greatly appreciate your efforts to  [help set up/provision] frontier bivouac  [#1/#2/#3/#4/#5].Please speak with the manager in charge of this assignment to collect your reward.1�
I'm terribly sorry, but we can't use broken 5����.Could you please return to the coalition assignment desk and procure us another?1�

It's so tough constructing frontier stations. It's always ��build, build, build,�� and ��scrounge, scrounge, scrounge.�� All I want is a little break from the monotony of it all.1�
It's so tough maintaining a frontier station. I'm always fending off bloodthirsty hellions and scrounging for provisions. All I want is a little break from the monotony of it all.1�
It's so tough maintaining a frontier station. I'm always fending off bloodthirsty hellions and scrounging for provisions. All I want is a little break from the monotony of it all.1�
What will you do?Look pleased.Cry a river.Act surprised.Rue your life.Cheer.Pretend to be flustered.Blush like a maiden.Rally the troops.Nothing for now.1�
Ahahaha!Of all the things to pull, I never thought you'd do that! I had no idea that was coming.1�
You don't know how much I needed something like that. Thank you.1�
Um...is something the matter with you?Maybe you should see a physician...1�
Approaching from that direction  �[might not have been very effective/was probably the right thing to do.].As for your gag,  [it wasn't with the times/it was right on the mark].1�
You don't know how much I needed something like that. Thank you.1�

You think I would have some work to do for one of your ilk? Bah. I only deal with those who have 6���� from the Pioneers' Coalition in Western Adoulin.1�
You are a pioneer, are you not? Surely you must have laid eyes on the noxious fumes rising up from the Zoldeff River while on duty!1�
They pose an obstacle, though not an unsurmountable one, for pioneer expeditions in the area. In fact, the Inventors' Coalition has devised portable boats to aid in crossing the river.1�
Yet all things come with a price. In this case, you will have to procure the materials yourself. Do that, and I will create such a device to assist you in traversing the toxic tributary.1�
Three %���� and one #���� and #���� each should be sufficient.1�

Boats are merely vessels for navigating the water. You must feel the currents, understand the eddies, and master the waves if you are to brave the river.1�
Cast off from the bank here, make your way to the other side, and return.1�
Boating is not merely about paddling, but also about controlling your center of gravity so as not to capsize. Have you learned this in your nautical jaunt?1�
...Well done! From here, it is but a simple task to find where to set sail and lay anchor.1�
I am duly impressed with your skill and tenacity. Few are able to cross such venomous waters.1�

It is difficult to express with words the wondrous feeling of becoming one with your watercraft. The dangerous poisons in this river should pose no more of a threat than if you were sailing on a stream of afternoon tea.1�
<Sigh> I'm sick of turning away all these pretenders. Not a one with 6����!1�

Since I'm so good, you must be itching to know what I'm doing all the way out here! Well, I've been trying all day to stare these out-of-this-world Delectable Orobons into submission, but--can you believe this--I've caught not a one!1�
They thrash about, making it impossible to get so much as one bucketful of bycatch! But that's neither here nor there--I want to taste succulent orobon flesh!1�

, she needs our help!1�

What happened out here!?1�
Excuse me, miss--were you sent by the Order of Janniston?1�
Oh, thank Altana! These pioneers, always so hardy and capable, just...collapsed! For no particular reason! I had sent word to the hospital back in the city hours ago, but received no response...1�
Perhaps I can be of aid.1�
There's some horrible disease making the rounds!? And no one knows why!?1�
So Hennetiel was not the only place stricken. The woods of Yorcia and the darkened fields of Morimar also report infections. We...we will assist to the best of our ability.1�
His symptoms are far more advanced than those suffering in Yorcia. Perhaps I can concoct a tincture to ease the pain...1�
, do you remember that time you brought back 6����? I have need of more, and quickly!1�

Let me take a look...6Yes, this specimen should be large enough to work with.1�

What's that noise?1�
Eeeeeeeeek!!!1�
It's going to eat us alive!1�
The medicine!1�
Alianne!!!1�
What bitter irony. She who only sought to aid others now needs aid herself.1�
, Mistress Svenja must be apprised of the situation forthwith!1�
Ah, a pleasant surprise to find you and Othellius out here! Hopefully the trip didn't overly exhaust you.1�

Well...he came down with the affliction that has taken many pioneers of late, and I fear has gotten in over his head.1�
